answers.answer: Hi!Calcification is the commonest ageing process that can cause stenosis or blockage of arteries. Presence of diseases such as diabetes, hypertension, uremia and hyperlipoproteinemia (high levels of lipoprotein cholesterol) can result in earlier calcification of these arteries.  Please consult your PCP for primary examination followed by proper referral.Take care!

question: a CT scan report says in part "note is made of a heavily calcified infrarenal abdominal aorta and arteriosclerotic calcifications extending into the right and left common and external iliac arteries.  I am concerned what this means.. everything I've found so far brings up aneurysm..
title: Aneurysm?
